etymology.description: 橙(橙) (chéng, "orange") + 皮(皮) (pí, "skin; peel") combines to refer directly to the literal outer layer or "peel" of the "orange" fruit. This combination is straightforward, with each character providing a specific meaning that, when combined, directly describes the nature of the object.
etymology.interpretation: The term 橙皮 (chéngpí, "orange peel") is a straightforward description of the outer layer (皮) of an orange (橙), which is commonly peeled off in order to eat the fruit.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢橙皮(我喜歡橙皮)。
做蛋糕时(做蛋糕時)，他加入了橙皮(他加入了橙皮)。
examples.pinyin: Zuò dàngāo shí, tā jiārùle chéngpí.
examples.english: When making cake, he added orange peel.

examples.chinese: 市场上(市場上)，橙皮卖得不错(橙皮賣得不錯)。
examples.pinyin: Shìchǎng shàng, chéngpí mài de bùcuò.
examples.english: In the market, orange peel sells well.
